info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 19 at 5:38PM CDT until April 19 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
FFWSJT
The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Central Coke County in west central Texas... South Central Nolan County in west central Texas...
* Until 845 PM CDT.
* At 536 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain near Robert Lee, moving northeast at 25 toward Blackwell and Bronte . Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1.5 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Robert Lee, Blackwell, E.V. Spence Reservoir Near Paint Creek Recreation Area, Sanco, Fort Chadbourne, The Intersection Of Highway 158 And Ranch Road 2059, Oak Creek Reservoir and Us-87 Near The Coke-Tom Green County Line.
This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Ross Rd. crossing Bouzier Creek, Hamilton crossing, Graham Valley crossing, Walnut crossing Little Walnut Creek, Walnut crossing Walnut Creek, Fields crossing, Collier crossing, Hurley crossing, Sanco crossing Yellow Wolf Creek and Arledge crossing Yellow Wolf Creek.
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 8:45 PM CDT. Avoid flooded areas.

National Weather Service: A FLASH FLOOD WARNING is in effect for this area until 8:45 PM CDT. This is a dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.

parameter.value: SNM: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS hasta 8:45 PM CDT. Evite areas inundadas.

Servicio Nacional de Meteorologia: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS en efecto para esta area hasta las 8:45 PM CDT. Esta es una situacion peligrosa y amenaza la vida. No intente viajar a menos que sea para abandonar un area propensa a inundaciones o bajo una orden de desalojo.
